intro: Clarkia lassenensis, commonly known as Lassen's clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in rocky, alpine environments. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in open meadows and along stream banks. Clarkia lassenensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in its native habitat.
